doc:
Al St. John https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al_St._John 0 Al St. John (September 10, 1892 – January 21, 1963) was an early American film comedian, and nephew of Roscoe “Fatty” Arbuckle, with whom he often appeared. He was employed by Mack Sennett and worked with many leading players such as Charlie Chaplin, Buster Keaton and Mabel Normand. In the talkies, he played the scruff-character "Fuzzy Q. Jones" in the Billy the Kid series. Al_St._John ( September_10_,_1892 – January_21_,_1963 ) was an_early_American_film_comedian , and nephew of Roscoe_“_Fatty_”_Arbuckle , with whom he often appeared . He was_employed by Mack_Sennett and worked with many_leading_players such_as Charlie_Chaplin , Buster_Keaton and Mabel_Normand . In the_talkies , he played the_scruff-character " Fuzzy_Q._Jones " in the_Billy the_Kid_series .
